derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (as a noun): from Old French canonique or Latin canonicus 'canonical', from Greek kanonikos, from kanon 'rule' (see canon). The adjective dates from the late 15th cent

sentences.sentence: "a canonical book of the Christian New Testament"

means.word_mean: 2. of or relating to or required by canon law
3. reduced to the simplest and most significant form possible without loss of generality;
4. conforming to orthodox or recognized rules;

sentences.sentence: "the drinking of cocktails was as canonical a rite as the mixing"- Sinclair Lewis
